definition: to cause trouble/to stir up trouble

sentences.english: The hecklers were conducted away from the hall at the request of the Chairman.
sentences.chinese: 主席要求把搗蛋分子強行趕出大廳。

sentences.english: The children are always up to amusing tricks.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們總是調皮搗蛋尋開心。

sentences.english: We pissed our teacher off again today, horsing around and acting up.
sentences.chinese: 今天我們調皮搗蛋，又把老師給惹怒了。

sentences.english: The actual trick-or-treating left much to be desired.
sentences.chinese: “搗蛋還是給糖”的活動還有許多值得期待的。

sentences.english: In many classrooms, Perry might simply have been regarded as a  troublemaker.
sentences.chinese: 在很多課堂上，佩裏可能都被認爲是個搗蛋鬼。

sentences.english: Bad: There is always a bad apple in every class.
sentences.chinese: 每個班級都有一個調皮搗蛋的學生。

sentences.english: The planets are being little gremlins this month, dear Aries.
sentences.chinese: 親愛的白羊們，這個月的行星有點像小搗蛋鬼。

sentences.english: He asked me for my name to book me, but thought I was just playing up.
sentences.chinese: 他讓我報出名字登記，卻以爲我在瞎搗蛋。

sentences.english: The old man blew up to those naughty boys who had disarrayed his corp.
sentences.chinese: 那個老人對那些弄亂他莊稼的搗蛋鬼。

sentences.english: Lavish on the love and hugs and strokes when she isn't into mischief.
sentences.chinese: 當她不調皮搗蛋時給她足夠的愛，擁抱和撫摸。

sentences.english: But there are some rascals making lif difficult for Santa Claus.
sentences.chinese: 但有一些搗蛋鬼故意爲聖誕老人制造麻煩。

sentences.english: She trick or treat love, but always make a few small kinked you.
sentences.chinese: 她愛搗蛋，但總是搞一些小的故意氣氣你。

sentences.english: Behavior or character typical of a rascal.
sentences.chinese: 無賴行爲流氓，惡棍，搗蛋鬼的行爲或特點。

sentences.english: The children have been acting up all evening.
sentences.chinese: 整個晚上孩子們都在調皮搗蛋。

sentences.english: Trick or treat , smell my feet.
sentences.chinese: 搗蛋還是給糖，聞聞我的腳丫子。

definition: to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to amuse oneself/to clown around/to provoke laughter
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
practical joke/prank/to play a practical joke
babbling nonsense (idiom); crazy and unfounded ravings/double Dutch
